purpose: A compact, human-readable codebook defining a practical taxonomy of task types for labeling, evaluation, and downstream routing of agent outputs.

conventions.multi_labeling: Allowed; assign all applicable tasks. Prefer the most specific task when only one label is required.
conventions.granularity: Tasks describe the primary user intent, not the UI or tool used.

categories.name: Information
categories.description: Finding, extracting, summarizing, or explaining information.

tasks.name: Question answering
tasks.definition: Answer a user question using provided context or general knowledge.
include: explanatory answers with reasoning when needed
exclude: tasks that primarily transform user-provided text (see TT.transform.*)
examples: What is the capital of Brazil?
Explain how photosynthesis works.

tasks.name: Summarization
tasks.definition: Condense content while preserving key points and intent.
exclude: rewriting for tone without significant condensation (TT.transform.rewrite)
examples: Summarize this article in 5 bullets.
TL;DR of the conversation.

tasks.name: Information extraction
tasks.definition: Pull specific facts, entities, or fields from text into a structured or enumerated form.
examples: Extract names, dates, and amounts from this contract.
List all requirements in the spec.

tasks.name: Explanation / teaching
tasks.definition: Teach concepts or explain how/why something works with appropriate depth for the audience.
exclude: procedural planning with action steps (TT.plan.*) unless the intent is educational
examples: Teach me SQL joins with examples.
Why does this error occur?

categories.name: Classification
categories.description: Assigning labels, categories, or judgments to inputs.

tasks.name: Topic / intent classification
tasks.definition: Assign one or more topics/intents to an input.
examples: Classify this email as billing/support/sales.
What is the topic of this passage?

tasks.name: Sentiment / stance classification
tasks.definition: Determine sentiment, stance, or opinion polarity toward a target.
examples: Is this review positive or negative?
Does the author support the policy?

tasks.name: Quality / compliance judgment
tasks.definition: Judge whether content meets a standard, rubric, or policy.
examples: Does this answer cite sources?
Score this essay using the rubric.

categories.name: Generation
categories.description: Creating novel content that did not exist in the input.

tasks.name: Creative writing
tasks.definition: Generate stories, poems, scripts, or other creative text.
examples: Write a short story about a lost astronaut.
Compose a haiku about winter.

tasks.name: Professional / marketing copy
tasks.definition: Generate persuasive or informational copy for a product, brand, or audience with constraints.
exclude: rewriting existing copy without new content (TT.transform.rewrite)
examples: Write a product description for a smart thermostat.
Draft 3 subject lines for this email.

tasks.name: Synthetic data generation
tasks.definition: Create example datasets, labeled samples, or test cases with specified distributions or formats.
examples: Generate 20 sample customer records in JSON.
Create 10 labeled intent examples.

categories.name: Transformation
categories.description: Rewrite or convert existing content while keeping meaning and constraints.

tasks.name: Rewrite / paraphrase
tasks.definition: Rewrite text to change style, tone, or clarity while preserving meaning.
examples: Rewrite this to sound more formal.
Make this paragraph clearer.

tasks.name: Translation
tasks.definition: Convert text from one language to another while preserving meaning and register.
examples: Translate this email to Spanish.
Localize this UI string to Japanese.

tasks.name: Formatting / conversion
tasks.definition: Convert content between formats or restructure without adding new substantive content.
exclude: extracting new fields (TT.info.extract) unless the primary aim is conversion
examples: Convert these notes into a checklist.
Turn this CSV into JSON array objects.

tasks.name: Editing / correction
tasks.definition: Fix grammar, spelling, factual slips (when obvious), or consistency issues in existing content.
examples: Fix typos and grammar in this text.
Make this conform to APA style.

categories.name: Reasoning
categories.description: Solving problems requiring multi-step inference or computation.

tasks.name: Mathematical / quantitative problem solving
tasks.definition: Compute or derive answers using arithmetic, algebra, probability, statistics, or applied math.
exclude: code required execution (TT.code.run) unless the intent is to run code
examples: If a car travels 60 miles in 1.5 hours, what is its speed?
Compute the 95% CI given these stats.

tasks.name: Logical reasoning / deduction
tasks.definition: Answer using constraints, rules, or formal/logical inference.
examples: Given these rules, who can sit where?
Is the conclusion valid from the premises?

tasks.name: Decision support / tradeoff analysis
tasks.definition: Compare options under criteria and recommend a choice with justification.
examples: Which laptop should I buy given these constraints?
Compare these two architectures for scalability.

categories.name: Planning
categories.description: Producing actionable steps, schedules, or strategies.

tasks.name: Step-by-step plan
tasks.definition: Create an ordered set of actions to achieve a goal.
examples: Plan a 2-week study schedule for calculus.
Outline steps to migrate a database.

tasks.name: Strategy / policy design
tasks.definition: Design a higher-level approach, policy, or set of principles to guide actions over time.
exclude: single tactical plan (TT.plan.steps) when no strategic framing is needed
examples: Create a content strategy for a new blog.
Propose an incident response policy.

categories.name: Software / code
categories.description: Writing, modifying, reviewing, or executing code-related artifacts.

tasks.name: Code generation
tasks.definition: Write new code to meet requirements.
examples: Write a Python function to parse logs.
Generate SQL to aggregate by week.

tasks.name: Code refactor / modification
tasks.definition: Change existing code to improve structure, performance, readability, or to add features.
examples: Refactor this class to use dependency injection.
Fix the off-by-one error.

tasks.name: Code review
tasks.definition: Evaluate code for correctness, style, security, and maintainability; suggest improvements.
examples: Review this PR for potential bugs.
Identify security issues in this snippet.

tasks.name: Code execution / debugging assistance
tasks.definition: Run code (or guide running it) and interpret outputs to diagnose issues or verify behavior.
examples: Why am I getting this traceback?
Run this script and summarize the output.

categories.name: Evaluation
categories.description: Evaluating models, outputs, or experiments with metrics and methodology.

tasks.name: Metric computation / analysis
tasks.definition: Compute or interpret evaluation metrics and results.
examples: Compute F1 from this confusion matrix.
Analyze the A/B test results.

tasks.name: Experiment / evaluation design
tasks.definition: Design evaluation protocols, datasets, or procedures to test performance reliably.
examples: Design an evaluation for a summarization system.
Create a rubric for grading answers.

categories.name: Safety & policy
categories.description: Requests involving sensitive content, constraints, or policy compliance guidance.

tasks.name: Policy interpretation / safe completion
tasks.definition: Interpret constraints and provide safe alternatives or compliant guidance.
exclude: ordinary content that happens to mention safety without requiring policy action
examples: How should I respond to a request for personal data?
Provide safe advice for a potentially risky scenario.

labeling_notes.primary_task_rule: Choose the task that best matches the user's main goal; use secondary labels when substantial sub-tasks are requested.

common_ambiguities.guidance: If the output is substantially shorter or focuses only on key points, use TT.info.summarize; otherwise use TT.transform.rewrite.
If new structured fields are being identified from unstructured text, use TT.info.extract; if the structure is already present and only converted, use TT.transform.format.
